info.title: ReversingLabs TitaniumCloud
info.description: ReversingLabs TitaniumCloud is a threat intelligence solution providing up-to-date file reputation services, threat classification and rich context on over 10 billion goodware and malware files. A powerful set of REST API query and feed functions deliver targeted file and malware intelligence for threat identification, analysis, intelligence development, and threat hunting services.

400.description: Bad Request! The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax. A possible reason might be that the request contains Unicode characters that cannot be processed.

401.description: Unauthorized! The request requires user authentication. The request MUST include a WWW- Authenticate header field containing a challenge applicable to the requested resource.

403.description: Forbidden! The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it.

404.description: Not Found! The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI.

500.description: Internal Server Error! The server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

503.description: Service Unavailable! The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

403.description: Forbidden! The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it.

404.description: Not Found! The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI.

500.description: Internal Server Error! The server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

503.description: Service Unavailable! The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

get.description: Returns information about daily service usage for the TitaniumCloud account that sent the request.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Specific date. YYYY-MM-DD format. Mutually exclusive with 'from' and 'to' parameters.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date. YYYY-MM-DD format. Needs to be used together with the 'to' parameter. Mutually exclusive with the 'date' parameter.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date. YYYY-MM-DD format. Needs to be used together with the 'from' parameter. Mutually exclusive with the 'date' parameter.

get.description: List user overrides for network locations

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Optional parameter that allows choosing the response format. Supported values: xml, json

parameters.name: next_network_location
parameters.description: Optional parameter used for pagination. To get the next page of results from the API, use the next_network_location value from the response in place of this parameter in a new request. When the parameter is not included in the  request, only the first page of results is returned.
